intro: Microstylis leucodon, commonly known as the white-stalked sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
